fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface IResponseHeaders


  • public interface IResponseHeaders
    Provides access to HTTP response headers. This does not include the response status code or message.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IHttpServiceCall.getResponseHeaders()

      • X_FRAME_OPTIONS

        static final String X_FRAME_OPTIONS
        HTTP X-Frame-Options response header. Non-standard but widely used for browser security.

        Valid values are: DENY, SAMEORIGIN, and ALLOW-FROM uri.

        Refer to Clickjacking Defense Cheat Sheet for further information.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • X_CONTENT_TYPE_OPTIONS

        static final String X_CONTENT_TYPE_OPTIONS
        HTTP X-Content-Type-Options response header. Non-standard but widely used for browser security.

        The only valid value is nosniff.

        Refer to Content Security Policy Cheat Sheet for further information.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • count

        int count(String headerName)
        Indicates how many times, if any, a specified HTTP header is explicitly defined.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        Returns:
        the number of values defined for this header. If 0, then the value is not explicitly defined.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addHeader

        void addHeader(String headerName,
               CharSequence value)
        throws IOException
        Adds a header with its value, without replacing any existing definition of this header included in the response.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the non-null value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addIntHeader

        void addIntHeader(String headerName,
                  int value)
           throws IOException
        Adds a header with its integer value, without replacing any existing definition of this header included in the response.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addDateHeader

        void addDateHeader(String headerName,
                   long value)
            throws IOException
        Adds a header with its date value, without replacing any existing definition of this header included in the response. The date will be encoded in RFC 1123 format in the UTC time zone.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getHeader

        String getHeader(String headerName)
        Gets the value of the named header, if defined.

        If defined multiple times (by calling addHeader(String, CharSequence) or by calling any typed variants of that method, without subsequently calling setHeader(String, CharSequence) or any of its typed variants), then the first value added for the named header will be returned.

        Note: some headers may be implicitly defined by default. Such headers are not enumerated when computing the value of count(String).

        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        Returns:
        the value for the named header, if defined explicitly or implicitly, or null if no value is available.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getHeaders

        List<String> getHeaders(String headerName)
        Gets all the values currently defined for the named header, if any. This will include explicitly-defined and implicitly-defined values.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        Returns:
        the list of all currently-available values for the named header, or an empty list if none.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setHeader

        void setHeader(String headerName,
               CharSequence value)
        throws IOException
        Sets a header with its value, replacing any current definition of the value.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the non-null value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setIntHeader

        void setIntHeader(String headerName,
                  int value)
           throws IOException
        Sets a header with its integer value.
        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setDateHeader

        void setDateHeader(String headerName,
                   long value)
            throws IOException
        Sets a header with its date value. The date will be encoded in RFC 1123 format in the UTC time zone.

        Note: for the Last-Modified header, the minimum effective value will always be greater than or equal to the creation time of the IHttpService. This prevents perceived inconsistencies when older files or resources are supplied to replace default or existing resources.

        Parameters:
        headerName - the HTTP header name.
        value - the value for the header.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addCookie

        ICookie addCookie(String name,
                  String value)
           throws IOException
        Adds a cookie to the response, which by default will remain valid until the client browser is stopped.

        By default, the cookie inherits the HTTP server's domain and path. You may need to replace these default values on the returned cookie instance when accessing the HTTP server using a reverse proxy.

        Parameters:
        name - cookie name.
        value - cookie value.
        Returns:
        the cookie added to the response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addCookie

        ICookie addCookie(String name,
                  String value,
                  int maxAgeInSeconds)
           throws IOException
        Adds a cookie to the response, with the specified maximum age.

        By default, the cookie inherits the HTTP server's domain and path. You may need to replace these default values on the returned cookie instance when accessing the HTTP server using a reverse proxy.

        Parameters:
        name - cookie name.
        value - cookie value.
        maxAgeInSeconds - the maximum age, in seconds. If -1, then the cookie should not expire until the client browser stops running.
        Returns:
        the cookie added to the response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers are already committed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • vary

        void vary(String headerName)
   throws IOException
        Adds information to the Vary header to indicate that the response can vary if retried with different request headers.

        For example, the same URI could send back a different resource representation if the client sends the request with different expectations for the language or content format. This may result in a composite header:

        Vary: Accept, Accept-Language

        If a cookie is added or if the server is using session cookies, this will automatically define the Vary: Cookie header.

        May be called multiple times, once per header.

        Parameters:
        headerName - the name of the header. Format is ASCII with optional hyphens, does not need to be a formally-defined header (can be custom). Set one header name at a time: multiple calls are concatenated.
        Throws:
        IOException - if headers have been committed or if the header name format is invalid.
        Since:
        1.0
